definition: to broadcast a lecture, a book reading etc
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: He often talks on the radio.
The President will radiobroadcast this evening.
sentences.chinese: 總統今晚將作廣播講話。

sentences.english: Tomorrow, as I have today, I shall speak over the London Broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 明天我還要和今天一樣在倫敦發表廣播講話。

sentences.english: The president noted the occasion in his weekly radio address.
sentences.chinese: 布什在每週一次的例行廣播講話中談到女兒的婚禮。

sentences.english: She is radiocasting very often these days.
sentences.chinese: 這些天她常常作廣播講話。

sentences.english: She recast her lecture as a radio talk.
sentences.chinese: 她把講稿修改成了一篇廣播講話。
